org.microtitan.diffusive.launcher.config.xml

Class RestfulDiffuserConfigXml

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.microtitan.diffusive.launcher.config.xml.RestfulDiffuserConfigXml

  • public class RestfulDiffuserConfigXml
extends java.lang.Object
    Configuration object for the REStful diffuser launcher. This object is persisted as XML and and the XML configuration is loaded into an object of this class for use by the RestfulDiffuserConfig object that configures the launcher.
    Author:
    Robert Philipp

    • Field Detail

      • LOGGER

        private static final org.apache.log4j.Logger LOGGER

      • XML_STRATEGY_CONFIG_FILE_NAME

        public static final java.lang.String XML_STRATEGY_CONFIG_FILE_NAME
        The name of the XML configuration file holding the diffuser strategy configuration. NOTE: This field is only used in the main(...) class for testing and to help create configuration files for strategies
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • XML_STRATEGY_CONFIG_CLASS_NAME

        public static final java.lang.String XML_STRATEGY_CONFIG_CLASS_NAME
        The fully qualified class name of the Class of the diffuser strategy implementation NOTE: This field is only used in the main(...) class for testing and to help create configuration files for strategies

      • classPathList

        private java.util.List<java.lang.String> classPathList
        List of end-points that serve up classes to the remote class loader. These end-points will be set for a newly created diffuser as part of its configuration, so that the new diffuser knows where to point its class loader in the event that it can't find a class locally. The end-points must be valid URI.

      • loadThreshold

        private double loadThreshold
        For diffusers created through calls to the server, this is the load threshold value. the threshold for CPU loads, above which the diffuser will send the tasks to a remote diffuser, unless of course, there are no client end-points specified. When the threshold is below the load threshold, the diffuser will call the local diffuser to execute the tasks.

      • serializerName

        private java.lang.String serializerName
        The name of the serializer used to serialize objects that get pass back and forth between the diffusers. The type of serialization doesn't, in and of itself, matter. What matters is that the diffusers use the same method of serialization so that the receiving diffuser can reconstruct (de-serialize) the object. The serializer is created from this name using the SerializerFactory.

      • strategyConfigClassName

        private java.lang.String strategyConfigClassName
        The name of the strategy class. This gets persisted, and is passed to the persistence reader to load the strategey from the strategy file

      • strategyConfigFile

        private java.lang.String strategyConfigFile
        The name of the configuration file (XML) that holds the configuration for the strategy. This is the XML file that the persistence reader uses to load the strategy configuration.

      • diffuserStrategy

        private DiffuserStrategy diffuserStrategy
        The strategy that is reconstructed from the XML persistence. This is not persisted, because it is persisted to a separated file.
